result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Randy Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO PIERCE COUNTY CASE 14CF32

miscConds.notes: Expungement may be applied for if the defendant successfully completes probation.
07-28-14 AMEND TO ADD RESTITUTION AMOUNT AT $1200

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Randy Schultz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on July 5, 2016 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: from William Thorie to Judge Boles re restitution

11:16  This also includes 14CF81   Defendant Kyle Randy Schultz in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie files amended information in 14CF32    Def will plead to Ct 3 in 14CF81 and the charges in the amended information on 14CF32 . S/W Probation 2 yrs.  $1200.00  restitution 14CF32.   Case 14CF81.    Dismiss Ct 1 & 2 in 14CF81   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 3 in 14CF81 and in 14CF32 to the charges in the amended information.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty of Ct 3 14CF81 and the charges in the amended information of 14CF32.   Ct 1 & 2 are dismissed in 14CF81.  Restitution has 2 parties that it is to be paid to. 14CF32  and 14CF81  on each count  S/W probation 2 years. concurrent to each other.  Conditions court costs , restitution 1200.00 Thorie is going to file an amended information on 14CF81 and only have Ct 3 which will now be Ct 1 of the amended information.  If the defendant  successfully completes probation the cases can be expunged.  Everything in these minutes that refers to Ct 3 of 14CF81 will now be Ct 1 of the amended information in 14CF81 which Atty Thorie will be filing today.
Plea hearing on July 8, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Subject to conditions of house arrest as follows: 

1.  Cannot leave home unless he is with his father, Brian Schultz
2.  No friends in the house without permission and supervision by Brian Schultz
3.  No substance use.
4.  Violations will be a violation of the bail bond
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Court goes over information with defendant.    Defendant enters not guilty plea on Count 1, Count 2 and Count 2 at preliminary hearing.  Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Not guilty plea received by the court.  Pretrial Conference to be set.  Attorney Nelson addresses court regarding bond and asks for house arrest rules.  Court asks court to amend to a signature bond with electronic monitoring.  Thorie agrees but wants rules put in place until electronic monitoring is installed.  Ms. Bjerke to prepare set of rules to go with signature bond.  Amends to $1,000.00 signature bond subject to rules.

1:39 p.m. Defendant Kyle Randy Schultz in court with attorney Liesl Nelson.  Bill Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews. with the defendant.  Judge exams the defendant re the waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Atty. Hargrove w/notation that Atty. L. Nelson will appear at 06/03 hearing.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

12:14 Defendant Kyle Randy Schultz in court, in custody.  William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Joshua Hargrove appeared in court with Def.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court read charges and maximum penalties.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie: $1000 cash bond with a no contact. Hargrove: def has no ability to pay; higher signature bond with same conditions. Court has questions about Def; Def not employed, attends school. Court: orders $1000 cash bond or father to sign an surety bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
